newsitem.title: SWEDEN: SKF sees sales 500 mln Skr in China '97.
newsitem.headline: SKF sees sales 500 mln Skr in China '97.

text.p: Swedish roller bearing group SKF AB said on Wednesday it would increase its sales in China to 500 million crowns in 1997 from 300 million crowns last year.
"We see a lot more sales in China in 1997," company spokesman Ake Svanberg told Reuters. "In total, we will sell (products) for about 500 million crowns in 1997."
SKF invests heavily in China and in February it set up two new joint ventures there, adding to the three it already had.
"China is a priority and we are investing several hundred millions of crowns to get established there," Svanberg said.
"Right now we are building our own organisation and in addition we will introduce SKF's manufacturing systems at our new plants."
Svanberg forecast that the investments in China would pay off in the next five or six years. But the Chinese market would show black figures before that as most sales consisted of imported goods.
"In coming years we will continue to grow very quickly in China and in the year 2000 it will be a large market for SKF," Svanberg said.
